content:
I'm interested in working on getting NLL migrate mode disabled (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/58781). What still needs to be done?

IIRC, there are cases where we emit "higher-ranked subtype error" without any context. However, I don't remember if that's just with -Znll, or with -Zno-leak-check as well
I'm hoping to get to this soon.

oh interesting I also made an issue about this the other day: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/78915

it has some examples of things that are different
@Aaron Hill I'd be interested in working with you and @Matthew Jasper to see this through
one thing I've been doing lately is setting up fixed times to sync with people
I don't have to be involved necessarily but if you wanted I could try to do that
I think if I don't do that, I'll never be of much use, too much going on :)
A weekly meeting sounds good to me
A weekly meeting sounds good to me
(For those following at home, Matthew has made great progress on the higher-ranked subtype errors in this branch)
